name: Marx_Brothers
text:
Marx Brothers
"Harpo, you talk too much."
 ―Groucho Marx
The Marx Brothers were a vaudeville troupe, comprised of at least five brothers, among them Groucho and Harpo.
The group performed at the Bijou Opera House in the late 1910s.
In a tape recorded for Diane Evans on February 20, 1989, FBI Agent Dale Cooper quoted Groucho Marx.
In 2016, Agent Albert Rosenfield compared Agent Randall Headley to the Marx Brothers.
Behind the scenes
The Marx Brothers were an American comedy act prominent in vaudeville, Broadway, and film in the first half of the 20th century, comprised of brothers Chico, Gummo, Harpo, Groucho, and Zeppo Marx.
